column1: Joint Damage causing Pain and Loss of Function
column2: Ken, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for several months following back surgery, a torn rotator cuff and a broken ankle. NSAIDS usually cause stomach pain and reflux for me, but not with Piroxicam unless I drink an alcoholic beverage.  My doctor says it is time released therfore reducing stomach irritation.  My back pain is much improved as is the torn rotator cuff.  The broken ankle is somewhat recent so it is difficult to determine its effect.  I will stop taking the medication for a short time to see if the back and rotator cuff pain returns.

column1: Joint Damage causing Pain and Loss of Function
column2: oldguy, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Injuries from military service in my late teens early 20s caused early onset of osteoarthritis in my back and knees.  I am 67 now and started taking this drug in 1981 while still in the military.  It has been great at relieving pain and stiffness in my joints and for me without any side effects or interactions.  I've taken it for so long now that I don't realize how good it is until I stop taking it.  After 3 or 4 days I notice the increased stiffness and pain.  My pain levels have increased over time such that I need additional pain medication now but the piroxicam still is doing its job.  I take 20 mg once a day in the morning.

column9: I have psoriatic arthritis, and severe back pain. The only pain meds I can take is darvocet (tylenol) because anything else causes bleeding. The symptom that Im most concerned with is that Im experiancing continuos tingling serges thoughout my body with any kind of body movement, that distorts and throws me off balance. The closest thing I can relate it to is when getting an epideral, the moment they first tap into your spine, you get a quick but very strong shot of tingles down the left side of you. Anyone else experiancing anything like this?

column2: BlackBear, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have a hernitaded disc in my back and I was have some Problems the past few weeks in my back my Dr. perscibe this medication to me and if you cannot take NSAIDS like me this mediction is not for you I have Upper GI bleeding ( Gerd ) and my Dr. wanted to try this med and it cause me to Bleed from my mouth and in my stools and it has cause SERVER stomach pain where I ended up at the hopital twice because of the pain and I was only taking it 1 time a daty and the dose was only 20Mg. it can cause blood clots which can cause a heart attack and or a stroke. now that my Dr. has given this to me I took my self of it after a week and now I have to go for all kind of testing now to see how much damaged it did to my stomach, I was couching up blood and waking up with blood in my mouth and having blood in my stool, SO PLEASE BECAREFUL when taking this medication, yes everyone body is different but I had a very hard time with it, also it can make you very sleepy  and light headed it does help alittle for chronic pain but some side affect do affect some people but some do and it did to me just wanted to let you folks know about this medication make sure you talk to your Dr. if you have stomach problems before taking this medcation , because again now I couching up blood and having bloody stools and now I have to go for a series of test to see what kind of more damaged it done to my stomach just after taking it for a week, My new PCP has many concerns and he wasnt happy with my old PCP. So if you cannot take NSAIDS then this med is not for you becasue as said on the perscrition notes it can be FATAL.   best of luck to all if you are taking this medication.
